bibl.title: The Poetic Style of the Greek Poet Sappho: A Study in Word Playfulness.
bibl.note: Foreword (by Edmund P. CUEVA). - Introduction. - 1. Sappho's Wordplay. - 2. Sapphic Humor. - 3. Sapphic Rhetoric. - 4. Sapphic Rhetoric, Continued. - 5. Sappho's Games of Love. - 6. Concluding Remarks. - Appendix: Gongyla, the Apple, and the Papyrus Evidence [P. Oxy. XXXII, 2637 (= M.-P.3 1949.3; LDAB 4820), fr. 35]. - Bibliography. Indices.
bibl.seg: ZELLNER Harold, The Poetic Style of the Greek Poet Sappho: A Study in Word Playfulness.
Lewiston, NY, E. Mellen, 2010, iv-130 pp., 1 fig. ISBN 978-0-7734-3626-8. $99.95.

Foreword (by Edmund P. CUEVA). - Introduction. - 1. Sappho's Wordplay. - 2. Sapphic Humor. - 3. Sapphic Rhetoric. - 4. Sapphic Rhetoric, Continued. - 5. Sappho's Games of Love. - 6. Concluding Remarks. - Appendix: Gongyla, the Apple, and the Papyrus Evidence [P. Oxy. XXXII, 2637 (= M.-P.3 1949.3; LDAB 4820), fr. 35]. - Bibliography. Indices.
